figure_1: The current classification of myeloid neoplasm. CNL: chronic neutrophilic leukemia, CMML: chronic myelomonocytic leukemia, JCMML: juvenile myelomonocytic leukemia, aCML: atypical chronic myelogenous leukemia.
figure_2: The rate of progression of chronic myeloid neoplasms to leukemic phase. Pre: pre-fibrotic stage of PMF and unexplained thrombotic events prior to the development of MPN.
figure_5: Factors that might determine the phenotype of JAK2 mutation positive disorders.
figure_6: JAK2 mutation burden during progression of MPNs. AL: acute leukemia, ET: essential thrombocythemia, MF: myelofibrosis, PMF: primary myelofibrosis, PV: poly-cythemia vera.
